website_summaries.verdict: Well-built dog flea comb that is effective for flea control for all sizes of animals at a reasonable price.
pros: Handle has a rubbery coating and an ergonomic design that makes it comfortable to use for long periods of time
Tightly spaced teeth will successfully catch the fleas and eggs
Teeth are aligned so they don't make contact with the skin
cons: Isn't as effective if you don't use a grooming comb first to remove any tangles in the fur

customer_reviews.title: Great comb
customer_reviews.text: I buy these soft grip combs and love them. I can come the dog for hours if i want and they will just stay. I have one that takes off at the sight of a comb, but these get her on the bed for her combing. I love them cause they are so darned comfortable in my hand, AND because the dogs like them too. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Bre Branco

customer_reviews.title: sharp flea comb
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid flea comber for our 2 cats (DSH) and short-haired dog. I can be a bit vigorous at times chasing down those pesky fleas. The tines on this comb were a bit too sharp and thin, and would actually bend and break off while I combed, scratching the poor critters. They would cringe or just run & hide when they saw me reach for it. I finally tossed it and bought one with shorter tines and more rounded tips. The pets seem pleasantly surprised. If you're a vigorous comber, watch out.
customer_reviews.author: ArtMom

customer_reviews.title: One vote yes, one vote no
customer_reviews.text: Works! My flea collar wearing inside dog produces 2-5 bodies every time I use it, supporting the claims of my old veterinarian that ALL dogs have fleas, and if they don't today, they will by next week (since fleas live forever and lurk in fabric, grass, and other course the hair of other animals just waiting for your dog to walk by). Only downside is the dog absolutely loathes it.
customer_reviews.author: Norm Al

customer_reviews.title: gets fleas
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepherd Dog, and this comb works very well for her type of coat. i first brush her and then the comb runs smoothly through the fur. The handle is comfortable and well made. My only negative is that the tines begin to bend after about a month or two and eventually the comb has to be replaced. But it is effective in picking out fleas if they are there.
customer_reviews.author: James G. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this flea comb!
customer_reviews.text: It worked perfect for finding and removing those pesky fleas on my cat. I have my bucket of hot soapy water ready, I comb it through the fur and dip it in the hot water. Wipe it dry and do it again. My cats enjoy the combing and the attention.
customer_reviews.author: Paige D.

customer_reviews.title: Works well on my pets
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these flea combs and they sure get the fleas. It has a nice handle, the edges of the tines are not too sharp, so as not to scratch the gang. I use the comb to remove fleas from my dogs and cats and they stick to the tines and I then put them into a bowl of soapy water to kill them. The dogs nor the cats seemed to mind my using this on them, so I rate this item pretty highly.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Danzeisen

customer_reviews.title: Teeth on Comb Not Set Properly
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible flea comb because about half of the teeth are so close together that they act as one larger tooth. Save your money and find one of the old fashioned flea combs with evenly spaced teeth. You don't need the fancy soft handle when the comb does not pull fleas off the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Onca360

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured - decent but not great
customer_reviews.text: The comb that was sent did not match the picture posted here online. The one sent was yellow and gray. I have another just like it. some of the tines have bent so that you can only comb in one direction or risk hurting your dog. Teeth are close together which is great for removing fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Conscious Eater

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome!.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for find those last fleas. Just be ready with paper towel or something like, to catch them before they can jump from brush. Doesn't bother pets as long as you are gentle.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow2000

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. The handle is comfortable. Teh cats mostly enjoy the combing. I catch many fleas with it. Teh teeth are far enough apart that many fleas get caught in between which allows me to catch them and drown them. When it picks them up they more frequently jump and get away.
customer_reviews.author: Lavender Tiger

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a puppy and unfortunately she had fleas. I purchased this item and tried it as soon as it arrived, combed my puppy and I found a flea and a tick! I immediately took my pup to the Vet and loaded in household flea treatments to prevent a bigger infestation!
customer_reviews.author: Cookmd

customer_reviews.title: Great Comb
customer_reviews.text: If you think your dog might have fleas this comb will find them .Plus the handle makes brushing easier Well made It should last a long time
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Cavallo

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to hold
customer_reviews.text: Works OK; but, I don't really want to catch any fleas. Have a jar of soapy water near by to push any fleas into when they land in the comb. Keep soap bubbles low in jar so they can't climb back out on the bubbles!
customer_reviews.author: DeeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: Didn't check the size when I bought it. Came in the mail and looked like a big screwdriver lol. Does its job though.
customer_reviews.author: Jtine3

customer_reviews.title: Great value and performance
customer_reviews.text: Does a fantastic job of collecting fleas without hurting the animal. Lovely handle in size, grip and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: stephblenman@msn.com

customer_reviews.title: I haven't got a single flea or tick out of my dogs with this comb!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't got a single flea or tick out of my dogs with this comb! I have 2 chihuahuas and have been using the comb like instructed and even though I can feel the ticks the comb wont get them out, and I comb them hard back and forth and nothing.
customer_reviews.author: julypena

customer_reviews.title: This item worked better than I had expected
customer_reviews.text: This item worked better than I had expected. The dogs do not seem to mind being combed and the fleas actually gets caught up in the tiny teeth as well as the flea droppings and you can decide on your method of destroying these teeny pests.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Helped me with my flea problem!
customer_reviews.text: This little bad boy helped me kill so many fleas. It was a true instrument of destruction. I cant recommend it enough, based on price and quick shipping and everything else. Thanks for making such a good little tool.
customer_reviews.author: frakskeert

customer_reviews.title: Good brush
customer_reviews.text: It works ok for fleas, but mostly I use it now to just brush my Schnauzer's hair. It is easy on the skin and gently gets out mats and tangles!
customer_reviews.author: thatviolingirl

customer_reviews.title: gigi
customer_reviews.text: This is highly recommend by vets and my dog has had issue with some fleas this year and it does what is should do and 100% please I did buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael West Virginia

customer_reviews.title: good price, good product
customer_reviews.text: I used the comb with my siberian husky and short hair domestic cat. It worked great with both of them, I for the fleas out of both with not much problems and they didn't seem upset about the comb. The only thing was at my sibe butt because he would really complain but that's because he would get wet all the time sitting at the small pool so the area was matted but this comb never claimed to be good for matted fur or shedding so it did for me what it should have.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Dantas

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Had a cheap one before that the pins would fall out this one is much better and same cost as the P O S cheap on I got that broke
customer_reviews.author: EkBMS

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: The teeth seem to be to big. The handle broke off a month later. Too expensive. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Good Price
customer_reviews.text: This flea comb was really good quality and offered at a great price. I actually expected it to be kind of cheap at that price, but it wasn't at all. In fact, I ordered a second one for my cousin to use on her dog.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wood

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is not as good as the cheaper 4 dollar comb but the comb is better made.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Douglass

customer_reviews.title: flea comb
customer_reviews.text: it works incredible, the tines are nice and close together, and they remove everything from the dog and cats. wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Misris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable grip makes it easy to use wet or dry.
customer_reviews.author: KayBee13

customer_reviews.title: Works like it Should
customer_reviews.text: the come is easy to use because of the handle and does what it is suppose to do comb out the dead fleas.
customer_reviews.author: gracious

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Would work better if my pet didn't detest being combed.
customer_reviews.author: shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Great comb.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. This is a sturdy flea comb for your pets. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: PTRdallas

customer_reviews.title: great comb
customer_reviews.text: this comb is great for animals in the summer very thick and durable. i do like this product a lot. i would purchase another
customer_reviews.author: rhonda

customer_reviews.title: dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have an extra comb to use to check for fleas on my dogs. I is easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: sandy m

customer_reviews.title: Teeth not fine enough
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised to read reviews where people say the teeth were too sharp. We had the opposite problem, the teeth were too thick. We didn't get any fleas using this. We bought one at the vet and immediately caught fleas.
customer_reviews.author: CGM

customer_reviews.title: perfect comb
customer_reviews.text: i bought this comb for my cats and it works great, so i would say this works well for both cats and dogs
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Kawczynski

customer_reviews.title: Works alright, but looks very different
customer_reviews.text: The one I received doesn't have the classy looking SS and black as shown in the picture, ours showed up in yellow and matte blue making it look real cheap. I picked this one over a cheaper one for a middle of the range and hopefully nice feeling / looking / working brush and it only fulfills one of the 3, working well...Though I guess that's most important!
customer_reviews.author: Alpen

customer_reviews.title: Great comb
customer_reviews.text: Works well with our animals and removesthe fleas easily. Works much better than other combs we have used that easily break.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Northey

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works quickly and easily to remove fleas from pets fur. Used on my cats and they didn't mind being brushed!
customer_reviews.author: April V Allegro

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: It works really well and is comfortable to use .I used it as directed and got lots of fleas off my dogs ,and drounded them in the dawn soapy water.
customer_reviews.author: ruth ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Good comb
customer_reviews.text: Excellent to remove tangles before using double row comb. My cat and dog both have long thick fur so this is important.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: flea comb
customer_reviews.text: doesn't work on dogs with hair longer than an inch. comb. looks well made. I have a sheltie an it just doesn't. work. for my anna
customer_reviews.author: anna simone gayle

customer_reviews.title: small tooth comb
customer_reviews.text: it seam the teeth are to far apart , other then that i already have that size i need realy need very small
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Knavel

customer_reviews.title: works great for dogs with undercoat
customer_reviews.text: I watched this at the dog park being used on a golden retriever. Works great creating ridiculous amounts of hairballs. Probably should only do outdoors. Unfortunately, I have a Vizsla which has no undercoat so I gave it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: R. McLaughlin

product_meta.title: JW Pet Company GripSoft Flea Comb for Dogs
product_meta.description: The Grip Soft Flea Comb is a comfortable ergonomically designed comb with metal teeth placed tightly together to pick up fleas in even the most dense coats. JW combs are specially designed with the teeth turned 90 degrees away from the skin to keep the teeth parallel to the skin while combing. This prevents raking" the skin while combing and is more comfortable for your pet."
feature_bullets: Metal teeth are placed tightly together to pick up fleas
Teeth are turned 90 degrees away from the skin to keep the teeth parallel to the skin
